text: Jitendra Prasad Sonal (also known as Jitendra Prasad Sonar) is a Nepalese politician. He is parliamentary party leader for the Loktantrik Samajwadi Party, Nepal in the Provincial Assembly of Madhesh Province . == Political life == Sonal, a resident of Bara, was elected to the 2017 provincial assembly elections from Bara 4(B) with 13118 votes. He was the Physical Infrastructure Minister for Province No. 2, Nepal till 6 June 2021. He including 3 other state ministers were expelled from Lalbabu Raut ministry on 6 June 2021 after a group of PSP-N joined government led by KP Sharma Oli and Sonal supported the same. == Electoral history == === 2017 Nepalese provincial elections === Party Candidate Votes Rastriya Janata Party Nepal Jitendra Prasad Sonal 13,118 CPN (Maoist Centre) Umesh Kumar Kushwaha 5,692 Nepali Congress Bijay Prakash Sah Rauniyar 5,133 Independent Suresh Prasad 3,962 Rastriya Prajatantra Party (Democratic) Ananda Prakash Yadav 1,231 Others 1,774 Invalid votes 1,658 Result RJPN gain Source: Election Commission ==References== Category:Living people Category:Nepalese politicians
title: Jitendra Prasad Sonal
